medical_history.chief_complaint: Subjective fever, nonproductive cough, and chest pressure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days before presentation, with chest pressure being constant and aggravated by deep inspiration and supine position. Decreased exercise tolerance noted; previously able to walk five blocks but now dyspneic over a few feet. Additionally, a 7-day history of watery diarrhea resolved 1 day prior to presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 2 diabetes, hypertensive cardiomyopathy, heart failure (most recent ejection fraction, 50 to 55%), hyperlipidemia, gout; previously hospitalized 5 years ago for systolic heart failure (ejection fraction of 20%).
medical_history.social_history: Patient emigrated from Thailand 10 years ago, does not drink alcohol or smoke tobacco.
